part.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a piece or feature of something such as an object, area, event, or period of time
part.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: in the early part of the 19th century
the early/later/latter/last part
The best part of the holiday was the food.
the best/worst part
You can see the final part of that series on Tuesday.
the first/final/last part etc
I shall be explaining this further in Part Two.
part two/three etc
Getting Dad to agree will be the hard part.
the hard/easy part
The jobs attracted people from all parts of the world.
different parts/all parts of something
the traditions that are an integral part of Jewish life
integral/vital/important part
The front part of the car was damaged.
part of
In parts of Canada, French is the first language.
part of
The cost of living is becoming unbearable for retired people in our part of the world (=where we live).
part of
More heat is lost through the head than any other part of the body.
part of
The film is very violent in parts.
in parts
part.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: one of the separate pieces that something such as a machine or piece of equipment is made of
spare parts (=kept for when a part breaks, needs replacing etc)
part.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Lay all the parts out before you start assembling the model.
part.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the words and actions of a particular character in a play or film
part.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Could someone take the part of Romeo, please?
Katharine’s playing the part of Mary in the school play.
part.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: the music that one type of instrument or voice within a group plays or sings
part.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The choir sings in four-part harmony.
part.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: used to say how much of each substance there is or should be in a mixture
part.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Prepare the glue with one part powder to three parts water.
The sulphur dioxide level in the air was 32 parts per billion.
part.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a piece or feature of something such as an object, area, event, or period of time
part.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: The school dates from the early part of the nineteenth century.
In the first part of the book he describes his childhood.
in the later part of the twentieth century
The festival lasts for ten days during the latter part of May.
We had reached the last part of our journey.
The worst part was having to work even when it was raining.
Deciding what you’re going to cook is the easy part.
Fresh fruit is an important part of our diet.
A ceasefire in the region is an essential part of any peace process.
These workshops are an integral part of the course.
Public transport varied between different parts of the country.
He had access to all parts of the factory.
The body is a complex thing with many constituent parts.
I cut the orange into four equal parts.
There are wars going on in many parts of the world.
He sometimes went to visit friends in other parts of the country.
The cancer may spread to other parts of the body.
The questionnaire is in two parts: part one asks for your personal details and part two asks for your comments on the course.
part.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 17: the words and actions of a particular character in a play or film
part.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: She plays the part of an ageing beauty queen.
He had a small part in ‘Casino Royale’.
When I was offered the part of the prince, I decided to take it.
I was thrilled when I was told I’d got the part.
Why did they give Sinatra the part?
He landed a part in a cop show.
She felt the studio hadn’t given her enough big parts.
Every time we do a play, the boys get all the good parts.
Toby had a small part in the film.
Taking the lead part of Annie will be 11-year-old Zoe Jones.
I had hoped to be given a speaking part.
She had had walk-on parts in a couple of soap operas.
part.translation[0].note_box[2].sections: part
something that together with other things forms a whole
It looks like part of a car engine.
The best part of the movie was the end.
The hardest part is getting started.
bit
a small part of something
Some bits of the book are really funny.
I didn’t read the bottom bit.
one of several different parts that you join together to make something
One of the pieces of the jigsaw puzzle was missing.
The furniture comes in several pieces.
component
a part of a machine or process
The company supplies engine components for trucks.
Education is a major component in a child’s growth and development.
section
a part of something that is clearly different and separate from other parts
The test is divided into two sections.
the reference section of the library
the string section of the orchestra
chapter
one of the numbered parts that a book is divided into
The opening chapter of the book sets the scene.
scene
one of the parts that a film or play is divided into
Some scenes had to be cut because they were too violent.
act 1, scene 2 of the play
episode
a part of a story on the television or the radio, which is told in separate parts
I missed last week’s episode.
part.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to move the two sides of something apart, or to move apart, making a space in the middle
part.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: When he parted the curtains, the sunlight flooded into the room.
The crowd parted to let him through.
Ralph’s lips parted in a delighted smile.
part.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to separate from someone, or end a relationship with them
part.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: He has parted from his wife.
part.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: if you part your hair, you comb some of your hair in one direction and the rest in the other direction
part.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The project is part funded by the council.
The object was part hidden by the grass.
part.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: a piece of something such as an object, area, or group
part.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: He will have to repay part of the money.
An important part of the trend towards globalisation is the growth of multinational enterprises.
part.translation[4].definitions[1].defin: one of the separate pieces that a machine, vehicle etc is made of
part.translation[4].definitions[1].examp: Demand for replacement parts is increasing as consumers repair aging cars.
a supplier of engines, equipment, and spare parts (=parts used to replace original parts that are broken) for commercial aircraft
part.translation[4].definitions[2].defin: some but not all of a particular thing or group of things
part.translation[4].definitions[2].examp: Only part of the company is being sold.
